newsitem.title: SWEDEN: Astra gets approval for Avonex in Europe.
newsitem.headline: Astra gets approval for Avonex in Europe.

text.p: Swedish drugs company Astra said on Monday it had received approval from the European drug authority, EMEA, for its new drug Avonex, that can be used to treat Multiple Sclerosis.
Astra said in a statement that Avonex would be on sale in Sweden in the near future.
"This is the first time that you have been able to find a treatment with visible effect on the handicap development of patients that are suffering from an incurable disease," the statement said.
"Until today no such treatment has been available."
Astra said Avonex worked to both slow down the development of the disease and to reduce the number of fits a patient suffered.
The approval follows a clinical study over the past two years that involved 301 patients aged between 16 and 55.
